title: Replaced

en: Having spent the week working on a client's job, you get it finished and send it in - only to be informed they hired someone else and won't be paying you for the work, "since they won't be using it."

no_caption: It's not worth raising a fuss over.

en: The client responds with a sassy e-mail, declaring that you never signed an official contract and the sparse verbal agreement guaranteed payment only upon use of the asset in question. You're not so sure if that makes a difference, legally. Still, they send you $100 'ex gratia' for your consultation - probably to keep you quiet.
You're cheesed-off, but you've already wasted so much time and energy on this. There's no reason to waste more.
You still leave a scathing - and anonymous - review for them online. Petty? Maybe, but you feel better.
